official-title.#text:
To designate certain Federal lands within the Cross
		  Island National Wildlife Refuge and the Petit Manan National Wildlife Refuge,
		  part of the Maine Coastal Islands National Wildlife Refuge Complex, in Lincoln
		  County, Hancock County, and Washington County, Maine, as
		  wilderness.

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Maine Coastal Islands Wilderness Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means the point on the
			 bank or shore up to which the water, by its presence and action or flow, leaves
			 a distinct mark indicated by erosion, destruction of or change in vegetation,
			 or other easily recognizable characteristic.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the Secretary of the Interior.

text.#text:
The
			 term

header.#text:
Additions to the
			 National Wilderness Preservation System

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the following Federal lands in the State of Maine
			 are hereby designated as wilderness and as components of the National
			 Wilderness Preservation System:

quote.#text:
Cross Island National
			 Wildlife Refuge: Islands Wilderness Proposal

quote.#tail:
. Cross Island
			 Wilderness includes six islands in a geographic cluster in Washington County
			 distributed over the following:

text.#text:
Certain lands in

Cross Island:
			 1,654 acres.

Inner Double Head

Outer Double Head
			 Shot Island: 14 acres.

Mink Island: 11
			 acres.

Scotch Island: 10
			 acres.

Old Man Island: 6
			 acres.

and dated May, 2010, which shall be

			 Refuge: Islands Wilderness Proposal

. Maine Coastal
			 Islands Wilderness includes seven islands distributed over the
			 following:

text.#text:
Certain lands in
			 the Petit Manan National Wildlife Refuge, comprising approximately 1,553 acres,
			 as generally depicted on the maps entitled

Outer Heron Island
			 (Lincoln County): 66 acres.

Outer White Island
			 (Lincoln County): 16 acres.

Little Marshall
			 Island (Hancock County): 14 acres.

John’s Island
			 (Hancock County): 43 acres.

Bois Bubert Island
			 (Washington County): 1,321 acres.

Inner Sand Island
			 (Washington County): 18 acres.

Halifax Island
			 (Washington County): 75 acres.

As provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, nothing in this Act shall be construed as affecting the
			 jurisdiction or responsibilities of the State of Maine with respect to wildlife
			 and fish.

does not intend for the designation of wilderness
			 areas in the State under this section to lead to the creation of protective
			 perimeters or buffer zones around any wilderness area.

text.#text:
The fact that nonwilderness activities or
			 uses can be seen or heard from within a wilderness designated by this Act shall
			 not, of itself, preclude the activities or uses up to the boundary of the
			 wilderness area.

header.#text:
Activities or
			 uses up to boundaries

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may authorize the installation of navigational devices in any
			 wilderness area designated by this Act for the purpose of improving public
			 health and safety.

text.#text: Consistent with the purpose of the

Nothing in this Act shall be construed as prohibiting
			 the landing of a watercraft on an island on which is located any area
			 designated as a wilderness area by this Act.
